channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Gas cannisters and balloons, 26th July
item.description:
Every weekend, recently, the area outside the old Hainault is littered with balloons and gas cannisters
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hardwick Court, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches overhanging road, 26th July
item.description:
There are a couple of trees with branch’s hanging over the road at the top of drive that look quite dangerous and there are lots of people walking up and down the road to walk to Scott’s Park . Trees are opposite 56 and 58 Romney drive

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Romney Drive, Elmstead, London

item.title: Outside no 79: Norfolk Road EN3, 26th July
item.description:
A large quantity of cardboard and polystyrene on the pavement, blocked Ng part of footway. Dangerous for the visually impaired. Appears to be overflowing from front garden of no 79. Their recycling bin is also abandoned on the pavement rather than stored on their property. Please clear and educate!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norfolk Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped cat tree, matress, bin. Furniture on pedestrian path. Flytipping is increasing every day and is now a hazzard. Please remove items and clean path. Can a notice go up with no fly tipping please. Thank you, 26th July
item.description:
Huge amount of flytipping at the end of Sultan street. Cat tree, furniture, mattress, rubbish bin, sofa etc. This seems to increase every day. Please clean and remove as pedestrian path is blocked and it is a hazard. Can a no flytipping sign go up please. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchfields Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 84 shoot up hill, 26th July
item.description:
Significant indentantions in the road near the bus stop that shake the fou dation of the nearby buildings. Thus is 24 hour problem. Very poor patching job that created more problems than solved. With all the heavy trucks and buses that pass along this is getting worse.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shoot-Up Hill, London

item.title: Fed up with the mess on our streets, 26th July
item.description:
Constant fly tipping area and hackney council just don't address it. Why? Broken tiles and bathroom suites posing a risk to children and wildlife. Grotty residential bags of waste, torn open and spilling out to attract wildlife. Council not picking up.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cazenove Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside - Chestertons, 55-56 Hampstead High St, Hampstead, NW3 1QH and on Heath Street, 26th July
item.description:
There are some loose areas around the light wells in the pavement. We are experiencing water ingress when it rains and it is flooding our basement kitchen. Can we cover the holes in the light wells, do we need to seek permission from Camden Council to do this?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Hampstead High Street, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping not been cleared after 1 week, 26th July
item.description:
This house-hold rubbish has been dumped for 1 week now and is an environmental hazard putting local residents & children at risk. This is URGENT.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): King James Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet
